ei.proto.negotiation.qfnegotiation
Class QFNegotiationInit

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.behaviours.Behaviour
      jade.core.behaviours.CompositeBehaviour
          jade.core.behaviours.SerialBehaviour
              jade.core.behaviours.FSMBehaviour
                  jade.proto.ContractNetInitiator
                      ei.proto.negotiation.qfnegotiation.QFNegotiationInit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class QFNegotiationInit
extends jade.proto.ContractNetInitiator

Initiator role for a QF_NEGOTIATION protocol, with the QFNegotiationOntology. This protocol is based on FIPA_ITERATED_CONTRACT_NET:

  • a CFP with a CompetenceCall is sent for each agent;
  • a Proposal is received from each agent participating in the negotiation;
  • a multi-round negotiation takes place, in which:
    1. proposals are evaluated, and qualitative feedback is generated for each attribute;
    2. a new negotiation round is started by sending a new CFP with a ProposalEvaluation;
    3. new proposals are received from each participating agent.
  • the best proposal received is accepted, and the other proposals are rejected.

Author:
pbn, hlc
See Also:
Serialized Form

generateFeedback

protected void generateFeedback(ProposalSet proposalSet,
                                Need need,
                                double riskT,
                                java.util.Vector<InterestedAgent> agents)
The agent Negotiation Mediatior (NegMed from now on) receives a set of Proposals from participating Sellers in each negotiation round and evaluates each one in order to provide a qualitative feedback for each proposed attribute value. This feedback can consist of the following comments: "excellent", sufficient, "bad" or "very bad". The proposal evaluation can be divided into two parts:
  1. Proposals initial evaluation. Initially, the utility value of each proposal is calculated based on EA-starter's preferred values for each attribute. For that, we obtain the sum of the differences of each proposed attribute value to the EA-starter's preference -- a deviation. The utility value is obtained using the following formula: 1/deviation. Each attribute in each proposal is tagged with the direction ("up" or "down") it should take towards the EA-starter's prefered values. At the end of this evaluation, the best proposal is determined.
  2. Proposal classification. The best proposal is used as a target for attribute classification of each proposal ("excellent", "sufficient", "bad" or "very bad"). A difference delta between the attribute value in the best proposal and in the current proposal is calculated: (currentProposalAttDiff - bestProposalAttDiff) / bestProposalAttDiff. This value is used to assign the qualitative feedback introduced above.

Parameters:
proposalSet - The set of proposals to be evaluated; feedback is inserted into these objects
need - The need that is being negotiated
